sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UK Ministry of Defense reported that satellite imagery shows that Russian forces have constructed firing defense positions on the roofs of several reactor buildings at the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant, the largest in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russia has controlled it since March 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, this is the first indication of the actual reactor buildings being integrated in tactical defense planning. Russia has likely constructed these positions because it is increasingly concerned about the prospects of a major Ukrainian counteroffensive. The move highly likely increases the chances of damage to the safety systems if fighting takes place around the Zaporizhia nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, direct catastrophic damage to the reactors is unlikely under most plausible scenarios involving infantry weapons because the structures are very heavily reinforced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Down the Dnipro River in the region of Kherson, Ukrainian forces continue to strike Russian logistics and concentration areas on the east banks, says the Institute for the Study of War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Delegated footage published showed Ukrainian forces striking Russian positions north of Korsunka, southwest of Rybalche, as well as the Russian observation post in Kozachi Lahiri. Ukrainian Southern Operational Command spokesperson Natalia Khomenyuk stated that Ukrainian forces are already quietly conducting counter-offensive activities in Kherson region by targeting Russian ammunition depots as well as equipment and manpower concentration areas.

sentences.sentence: In a carefully calibrated speech he demanded that the European Union approve safe and legal ways for migrants to enter and repeated his condemnation of quote gender ideology.

sentences.sentence: Orban has called for a ceasefire, but Hungary's prime minister has refused to supply Kyiv with weapons and threatened to veto EU sanctions against Moscow while maintaining Hungary's strong dependence on Russian energy. Sporadic fighting in the Sudanese capital and beyond continued on Thursday, despite

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: the two warring factions agreeing to prolong a three-day ceasefire by another 72 hours after international mediation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Since the confrontation between the army and the rapid support forces broke out on April 15th, over 500 people have been killed, mainly by airstrikes and artillery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Thousands more have been wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There's also been extensive damage to buildings in Khartoum and some other cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: All of which has resulted in a mass exodus, not just of foreign residents, but of Sudanese people too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The United Nations has warned that as many as 270,000 people could flee into Sudan's poorer neighbours, South Sudan and Chad, threatening regional stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Bulgarian Nicoleta Elbalula's escape from Sudan began on the day fighting erupted on the streets between the Sudanese army and the paramilitary unit known as the Rapid Support

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Force. We were just woken up by the fire, by the crutches or by the tanks that were in the place where we live.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Nicoleta left with her husband Abdul Hassan from a military base in Sudan, flying into Jordan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: From there they caught a flight to Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Eventually they made it home to Bulgaria, but without their grown-up children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's expected Nicoletta will be reunited with her children in the coming days, but the nightmare memories of fleeing a war zone are unlikely to fade any time soon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And despite a fragile ceasefire, the ordeal continues for those remaining in Sudan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: London's world-famous wax museum Madame Tussauds has added a figure of the soon-to-be Queen Camilla ahead of next week's coronation ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Currently known as the Queen Consort, Camilla is to be crowned alongside her husband, King Charles III, on Saturday, May 6.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Her accessories include replicas of the late Queen's Belgian sapphire tiara, a Georgia 6 sapphire necklace, an Art Deco engagement ring and a Welsh gold wedding band.

It's not the only country tapping Russian expertise in nuclear power Moscow's spreading its nuclear know-how around the world for some countries cooperation with Russia is an attractive prospect. It has also been able to offer a type of a one-stop shop offer to many countries, where it offers all levels of cooperation, from training the staff to work in the plant, to designing, to planning, to building the plant, to supplying the fuel, to taking care of the waste, and so on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Also into the future, if they are able to continue with the work that they have been doing so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And it also offers channels for creating dependency, creating strong links at many different levels between Russia and many countries around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After the full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the West imposed new sanctions on Russia, but are they enough to thwart Moscow's nuclear strategy?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia is quite good at getting around and adapting to sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And often, Western actors overestimate the impact of sanctions and are not active enough in implementing sanctions and in tightening them to really stop Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So if the West wants to stop Russia, it probably needs tougher sanctions.
